author: from staff reports
title: Sports Roundup
text:
Posted: Tuesday, October 13, 2015 6:00 am Sports Roundup from staff reports The Cumberland Times-News 
Frostburg’s Worthman named Co-Offensive Player of the Week 
YORK, Pa. – Frostburg State women’s soccer senior midfielder Erin Worthman has been named the Capital Athletic Conference Co-Offensive Player of the Week, as announced by the league Monday. 
Worthman, FSU’s leading goal scorer, tallied a career-high five goals in the Bobcat’s 5-1 route of Penn State Harrisburg on October 5. Her five goals broke the CAC record for most goals in a league match, while her 10 points set the CAC record for most points in a single game. 
She also tallied two shots, one on goal, against conference rival Salisbury on October 10. The Bobcats and Sea Gulls battled to a double-overtime 0-0 draw. 
Worthman shares the weekly award with Claire Kostelnik from St. Mary’s. 
FSU returns to action Wednesday, October 14 as it travels to Marymount (Va.) for a 7 p.m. CAC matchup. 
FSU kicker honored for second time 
EWING, N.J. — Frostburg State junior kicker Isaac Robinson has garnered New Jersey Athletic Conference (NJAC) Special Teams Player of the Week honors for the second time this season after helping the Bobcats to a 37-19 win over William Paterson. 
Robinson was 3 for 3 on field goals, 3 for 3 on extra point attempts and averaged 59.1 yards on seven kickoffs, including two touchbacks. 
Robinson opened the game’s scoring against the Pioneers with a 32-yard field goal late in the first quarter. As time expired in the first half, he connected on a 25-yard field goal and later added another 25-yarder in the fourth. 
Robinson, a Fred Mitchell Award honoree for the month of September, has made six field goals on the season and is 17 for 17 on PATs. He is also averaging 56.4 yards per kickoff with five touchbacks. 
Frostburg State hosts The College of New Jersey this Saturday at 1 p.m. on Homecoming. 
Mountain Ridge girls earn academic honor 
FROSTBURG – The Mountain Ridge High School girls soccer program has been recognized by the National Soccer Coaches Association of America, which recently announced its team academic awards for the 2014-15 school year. 
The Lady Miners, who won the Area and Appalachian Mountain Athletic Conference championships last year and are currently 10-0 this year, were one of 397 soccer teams in the country to earn the NSCAA Team Academic Award for exemplary performance in the classroom. To qualify, the team must have a minimum grade-point average of 3.25 for the entire academic year. The team grade-point average is determined by adding each player’s GPA and dividing that total by the number of players on the team. 
Mountain Ridge earned the team academic award with a 3.98 grade-point average. 
Of the 397 soccer teams to earn the award, 149 were boys teams and 248 were girls teams. Sign Up / Sign In
